summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the indictment of two correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, for falsifying records at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night of August 9-10, 2019, when inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide. The document details the charges and alleges the officers failed to conduct mandated inmate checks.

events.title: Epstein Arrested and Detained at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and detained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had an apparent suicide attempt, leading to his transfer to suicide watch and then psychological observation.

events.title: Epstein Moved Back to SHU
events.description: Epstein was moved back to the Special Housing Unit, with the MCC taking additional steps to guard against future suicide attempts.

events.title: Start of Noel and Thomas's Shift
events.description: Tova Noel began her shift in the SHU at 4:00 p.m. Michael Thomas began his shift at 12:00 a.m. on August 10. They were responsible for conducting inmate counts and rounds.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Discovered
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Tova Noel and Michael Thomas discovered the body of Jeffrey Epstein, who had committed suicide by hanging himself earlier that morning while unobserved.

events.title: Noel and Thomas Indicted
events.description: The indictment against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas was unsealed. They surrendered this morning.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the MCC
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were indicted for falsifying records and conspiring to defraud the United States by failing to conduct mandated inmate checks at the MCC.
On the night of August 9-10, 2019, no correctional officer conducted any count or round of the Special Housing Unit from approximately 10:30 p.m. until 6:30 a.m., when Epstein's body was discovered.
Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging himself in his cell in the SHU during the period when no checks were being conducted.
Noel and Thomas allegedly signed false certifications attesting to having conducted inmate counts they never performed.
The indictment highlights a critical failure in the protocol meant to ensure inmate safety, particularly for Epstein who was considered a suicide risk.
